{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3256399,"name":"Ash Sabine","username":"MxMasterCarr","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mxmastercarr/{size}/203936_2.png","created_at":"2023-11-22T19:33:25.719Z","cooked":"

Spent the better part of 8 months on this project. Backlash issues had a significant hand in killing our 2023 bot, Voyager - a 2 jointed arm design - so I decided to see if I could stick a few nails into backlash’s coffin. Behold, the PyreCycloidal! Named for nothing in particular, I just like fire themes.

image1095×778 101 KB

image1310×836 137 KB

image1079×744 78.7 KB

image1577×594 244 KB

image1399×870 86.1 KB

Dimensions

  • Body OD: 78mm
  • Mount OD: 102mm
  • Thickness (face2face): 24mm
  • Total thickness: 27.556 mm

Details

  • 400:1 reduction
    • Compact double stage design, see DOI: 10.1115/1.4004540
  • 1600 N*m max allowable torque
    • If I did my math right… would appreciate a double check
  • Sheet metal construction (allowing use of 2.5d machining)
    • For US-standard sheet, requires a facing cut (unfortunately)
    • Hardest op is a series of blind holes used to hold retaining pins, although these can be replaced w/ throughholes assuming there’s not much axial load
  • ~$85 (minus shipping) for non-sheet materials, comparable to COTS options (ish)
    • We recommend getting the MR85ZZ and 693ZZ ball bearings from a Chinese supplier
    • Alternatively, said bearings can be substituted for bushings (but this will impact efficiency & max allowable torque)

Links

  • Onshape link
  • Parts list

Team 449 is currently working on assembling a working example! We have the parts ordered and are waiting for them to be delivered.

If the rest of the team allows it, yeah! The idea was to hopefully have an example assembled by the time our Bunnybots event rolls around, although the delivery time for the smaller bearings means that probably isn’t going to happen.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2023-11-22T20:04:55.256Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":450,"readers_count":449,"score":90.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":444726,"topic_slug":"pyrecycloidal","display_username":"Ash Sabine","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":28214,"username":"pchild","name":"Preston Childress","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/pchild/{size}/168439_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":58946,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"449 :: cad/machinist :: they/them"},"post_url":"/t/pyrecycloidal/444726/7","custom_user_title":"449 :: cad/machinist :: they/them","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3256434,"name":"Anand Rajamani","username":"asid61","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/asid61/{size}/7179_2.png","created_at":"2023-11-22T20:19:26.585Z","cooked":"

I’ll have fun looking at this later. Excellent design, getting the weight down to under 1lb is very impressive! The hardest thing about cycloids, apart from the huge BOM of pins and bearings, is the weight and size. It seems like you could cut down on the BOM by milling all of the pin profiles out of a single steel sheet, though this could increase the weight.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2023-11-22T20:19:26.585Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":433,"readers_count":432,"score":116.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":444726,"topic_slug":"pyrecycloidal","display_username":"Anand Rajamani","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":21715,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/pyrecycloidal/444726/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3256438,"name":"Skye Leake","username":"Skyehawk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png","created_at":"2023-11-22T20:43:28.101Z","cooked":"

Seriously cool design work, must have learned a lot in the process, bravo.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2023-11-22T20:43:28.101Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":409,"readers_count":408,"score":111.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":444726,"topic_slug":"pyrecycloidal","display_username":"Skye Leake","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":19235,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Pretengineer"},"post_url":"/t/pyrecycloidal/444726/9","custom_user_title":"Pretengineer","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3256464,"name":"Ash Sabine","username":"MxMasterCarr","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mxmastercarr/{size}/203936_2.png","created_at":"2023-11-22T22:40:35.832Z","cooked":"

I had thought about this, but getting the proper end profile for them to fit in the sheet & getting the correct tolerances (the pins are oversize, for press fit) would have made the design pretty inaccessible.
The largest influence on the BOM is actually the ball bearings! I had considered jumping ship to a more novel type of reducer called an “abacus drive” which eliminates ball bearings from the BOM entirely (in favor of bearing balls), but it would have required cutting & hardening custom races, which just didn’t seem achievable with 2.5d machining.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2023-11-23T00:29:21.253Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":389,"readers_count":388,"score":82.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":444726,"topic_slug":"pyrecycloidal","display_username":"Ash Sabine","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":21715,"username":"asid61","name":"Anand Rajamani","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/asid61/{size}/7179_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":58946,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"449 :: cad/machinist :: they/them"},"post_url":"/t/pyrecycloidal/444726/10","custom_user_title":"449 :: cad/machinist :: they/them","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3256580,"name":"Nyx","username":"gellnick","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gellnick/{size}/172273_2.png","created_at":"2023-11-23T07:58:02.191Z","cooked":"

If I can easily change the gear ratio I am definitely using this on an upcoming project. I’ve been looking for a good high torque gearbox I can make myself for a couple high powered projects lately, this looks to fit the bill!
Edit: Thanks for the cover, makes outdoors protection a lot easier!

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2023-11-23T07:58:50.064Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":333,"readers_count":332,"score":91.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":444726,"topic_slug":"pyrecycloidal","display_username":"Nyx","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":29971,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Everything and nothing, all at the same time"},"post_url":"/t/pyrecycloidal/444726/11","custom_user_title":"Everything and nothing, all at the same time","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3256616,"name":"Ash Sabine","username":"MxMasterCarr","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mxmastercarr/{size}/203936_2.png","created_at":"2023-11-23T16:09:17.500Z","cooked":"

Would love to see how it turns out! The project is fully parametric, so you should be able to change parameters pretty easily. The only restriction is the gearing ratio of the first and second stage has to be the same. (Edit: This is to prevent vibration. This need not apply if vibration is not a problem.)
